.. index:: BinaryTournament

.. _l42696e617279546f75726e616d656e74:

BinaryTournament S
==================

:viewcode:`tree.spad line 275 <tree.spad#L275>` :editcode:`[edit on github] <tree.spad#L275>`

* S: \ :ref:`OrderedSet <l4f726465726564536574>`\ 


BinaryTournament(S) is the domain of binary trees where elements are ordered down the tree. A binary tournament is either empty or is a node containing a \ :spadfun:`value`\  of type \ ``S``\ , and a \ :spadfun:`left`\  and a \ :spadfun:`right`\  which are both BinaryTree(S)


.. _l42696e617279546f75726e616d656e74-23:

\ :ref:`# <l416767726567617465-23>`\ \: % -> \ :ref:`NonNegativeInteger <l4e6f6e4e65676174697665496e7465676572>`\  
  from \ :ref:`Aggregate <l416767726567617465>`\

  from \ :ref:`BasicType <l426173696354797065>`\

\ :ref:`any? <l486f6d6f67656e656f7573416767726567617465-616e793f>`\ \: (S -> \ :ref:`Boolean <l426f6f6c65616e>`\ , %) -> \ :ref:`Boolean <l426f6f6c65616e>`\

.. _l42696e617279546f75726e616d656e74-62696e617279546f75726e616d656e74:

.. index::
   pair: BinaryTournament; binaryTournament

:spadfun:`binaryTournament`\: \ :ref:`List <l4c697374>`\  S -> % 
  \ ``binaryTournament(ls)``\  creates a binary tournament with the elements of \ ``ls``\  as values of the nodes.

:spadfun:`insert!`\: (S, %) -> % 
  \ ``insert!(x, b)``\  inserts element \ ``x``\  as a leave into binary tournament \ ``b``\ .
